objects.name: Analytic 0855
objects.description: Defender observes configuration changes on firewall/network appliance involving rule creation, modification, or deletion from abnormal management IPs or non-console channels (e.g., remote CLI, API). These are often correlated with a spike in previously blocked outbound traffic, unexpected allow-all rules, or bulk rule deletions. Behavior often follows unauthorized login, privilege escalation, or API abuse.

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: networkdevice:Firewall
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: update_rule: Access control or NAT rule modified or disabled outside maintenance window

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: networkdevice:Firewall
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Login from untrusted IP, or new admin account accessing firewall console/API

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: networkdevice:Firewall
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Audit trail or CLI/API access indicating commands like no access-list, delete rule-set, clear config

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: NSM:Flow
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Outbound traffic spike through formerly blocked ports/subnets following config change

x_mitre_mutable_elements.description: Allowlisted IPs/subnets where administrative access is expected (e.g., jump box, VPN mgmt)
Expected maintenance window (e.g., 02:00–04:00 UTC) to filter benign changes
Number of rules affected or port ranges modified to determine severity
Flag new users making changes without observed privilege elevation path
